meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be absorbed or soaked up.
meanings.sent1: The sorbabilities of the sponge make it great for cleaning up spills.
meanings.sent2: The soil's sorbabilities determine how well it retains water.
meanings.sent3: The sorbabilities of the paper towel saved the day when the juice spilled.
meanings.sent4: Her mind had the sorbabilities of a sponge, soaking up every detail of the lecture.
meanings.sent5: The sorbabilities of the fabric were put to the test in the rainstorm.

meanings.definition: The ability to be taken in or assimilated.
meanings.sent1: The sorbabilities of the plant roots help them absorb nutrients from the soil.
meanings.sent2: The sorbabilities of the medication vary from person to person.
meanings.sent3: The sorbabilities of the new information were impressive, as the students quickly understood the concept.
meanings.sent4: His sorbabilities for new languages were remarkable, picking up phrases effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The sorbabilities of the sponge were put to the test in the experiment.
